intro: Oplotheca texana, commonly known as the Texas oplotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water. Oplotheca texana is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and ecological restoration in arid regions.
